data.name: Promenade Fractions  2 – converting both ways
data.description:
> This is a more difficult version of the [Promenade Fractions](https://www.codewars.com/kata/5b254b2225c2bb99c500008d) kata. It is recommended you solve that one version first. 

## Taking a long walk
A promenade is a way of uniquely representing a fraction by a succession of “left or right” choices.

For example, the promenade `"LRLL"` represents the fraction `4/7`.

For a detailed explanation, see [Promenade Fractions](https://www.codewars.com/kata/5b254b2225c2bb99c500008d)

## Your task

Implement two functions; one which takes a promenade, represented as a string of `"L"`'s and `"R"`'s, and returns a fraction:

```python
promenade_to_fraction('')     == (1,1)
promenade_to_fraction('LR')   == (2,3)
promenade_to_fraction('LRLL') == (4,7)
```
```ruby
promenade_to_fraction('')     == [1,1]
promenade_to_fraction('LR')   == [2,3]
promenade_to_fraction('LRLL') == [4,7]
```

While the other takes a fraction and returns a promenade.

```python
fraction_to_promenade((4, 7))   == 'LRLL'
fraction_to_promenade((3, 11))  == 'LLLRL'
fraction_to_promenade((20, 71)) == 'LLLRLRRRRL'
```
```ruby
fraction_to_promenade([4, 7])   == 'LRLL'
fraction_to_promenade([3, 11])  == 'LLLRL'
fraction_to_promenade([20, 71]) == 'LLLRLRRRRL'
```

*Originally adapted from the 2016 British Informatics Olympiad*
